meanings.definition: To introduce one or more alkyl groups into (a compound)
meanings.sent1: I will alkylate the compound by adding alkyl groups to it.
meanings.sent2: Chemists often alkylate compounds to change their properties.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous scientist decided to alkylate the potion with extra alkyl groups.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity alkylated the team, injecting new ideas into their project.
meanings.sent5: The process of alkylating the compound was like painting with different colors, each alkyl group adding a unique touch.

meanings.definition: A compound formed by the alkylation of another compound
meanings.sent1: The alkylate was created through the alkylation process.
meanings.sent2: This alkylate is a result of combining different compounds.
meanings.sent3: The party was a mix of personalities, like an alkylate of diverse individuals.
meanings.sent4: His speech was an alkylate of humor and wisdom, leaving the audience inspired.
meanings.sent5: The painting was an alkylate of colors, blending together in a beautiful harmony.
